ArticleTitle.sentence: Angiotensin II activates the proinflammatory transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB in human monocytes.

event.clue: Angiotensin II activates the proinflammatory transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB in human monocytes.

AbstractText.sentence: The renin-angiotensin system may contribute to the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis.

event.clue: The renin-angiotensin system may contribute to the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis.
The renin-angiotensin system may contribute to the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis.

AbstractText.sentence: A common feature of all stages of atherosclerosis is inflammation of the vessel wall.
The transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB) participates in most signaling pathways involved in inflammation.

event.clue: The transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB) participates in most signaling pathways involved in inflammation.
The transcription factor nuclear factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB) participates in most signaling pathways involved in inflammation.

AbstractText.sentence: This study therefore examined the effect of angiotensin (ANG) II on NF-kappaB activation in monocytic cells, a major cellular component of human atheroma, by electrophoretic mobility shift assay.

event.clue: This study therefore examined the effect of angiotensin (ANG) II on NF-kappaB activation in monocytic cells, a major cellular component of human atheroma, by electrophoretic mobility shift assay.
This study therefore examined the effect of angiotensin (ANG) II on NF-kappaB activation in monocytic cells, a major cellular component of human atheroma, by electrophoretic mobility shift assay.

AbstractText.sentence: ANG II, like TNFalpha, caused rapid activation of NF-kappaB in human mononuclear cells isolated from peripheral blood by Ficoll density gradient.

event.clue: ANG II, like TNFalpha, caused rapid activation of NF-kappaB in human mononuclear cells isolated from peripheral blood by Ficoll density gradient.
ANG II, like TNFalpha, caused rapid activation of NF-kappaB in human mononuclear cells isolated from peripheral blood by Ficoll density gradient.

AbstractText.sentence: This ANG II effect was blocked by the angiotensin AT1 receptor antagonist losartan.

event.clue: This ANG II effect was blocked by the angiotensin AT1 receptor antagonist losartan.

AbstractText.sentence: Specificity of ANG II-induced NF-kappaB activation was ascertained by supershift and competition experiments.

event.clue: Specificity of ANG II-induced NF-kappaB activation was ascertained by supershift and competition experiments.
Specificity of ANG II-induced NF-kappaB activation was ascertained by supershift and competition experiments.

AbstractText.sentence: Moreover, ANG II stimulated NF-kappaB activation in human monocytes, but not in lymphocytes from the same preparation.

event.clue: Moreover, ANG II stimulated NF-kappaB activation in human monocytes, but not in lymphocytes from the same preparation.

AbstractText.sentence: Together, the data demonstrate the ability of the vasoactive peptide ANG II to activate inflammatory pathways in human monocytes.

event.clue: Together, the data demonstrate the ability of the vasoactive peptide ANG II to activate inflammatory pathways in human monocytes.
